notes:
1. Concept

Future Worth (FW), also known as Future Value (FV), is the value of a present amount or a series of payments at a specified date in the future, at a given interest rate. FW analysis is used to determine the future value of an investment.

2. Key Formulas (Interest Factors)

The formulas are often expressed using standard factor notation, where (X/Y, i, n) means "Find X, given Y, at interest rate i for n periods".

  • Find F, given P (Single Payment Compound Amount Factor, F/P):
    This calculates the future value of a single present amount. $$ F = P(1+i)^n = P(F/P, i, n)$$
  • Find F, given A (Uniform Series Compound Amount Factor, F/A):
    This calculates the future value of a uniform series of payments (annuity). $$ F = A \left[ \frac{(1+i)^n - 1}{i} \right] = A(F/A, i, n)$$

solvedExamples.question: If you invest $5,000 today at an interest rate of 7% compounded annually, what will it be worth in 10 years? The (F/P, 7%, 10) factor is 1.967.
solvedExamples.explanation: We need to find the future worth (F) of a present sum (P). We use the F/P factor. $F = P(F/P, i, n) = $5,000(1.967) = $9,835$.

solvedExamples.question: If you deposit $2,000 at the end of each year for 5 years into an account that pays 6% interest, how much will you have at the end of the 5 years? The (F/A, 6%, 5) factor is 5.637.
solvedExamples.explanation: We need to find the future worth (F) of an annual series of payments (A). We use the F/A factor. $F = A(F/A, i, n) = $2,000(5.637) = $11,274$.
